paragraphs.content: I am the rose of Sharon, and the lily of the valleys.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am the rose of Sharon, and the lily of the valleys.

paragraphs.content: As the lily among thorns, so is my love among the daughters.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As the lily among thorns, so is my love among the daughters.

paragraphs.content: As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste.

paragraphs.content: He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me was love.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me was love.

paragraphs.content: Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I am sick of love.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I am sick of love.

paragraphs.content: His left hand is under my head, and his right hand doth embrace me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His left hand is under my head, and his right hand doth embrace me.

paragraphs.content: I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.

paragraphs.content: ¶ The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.

paragraphs.content: My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: behold, he standeth behind our wall, he looketh forth at the windows, shewing himself through the lattice.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: behold, he standeth behind our wall, he looketh forth at the windows, shewing himself through the lattice.

paragraphs.content: My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.

paragraphs.content: For, lo, the winter is past, the rain is over and gone;
paragraphs.contentHtml: For, lo, the winter is past, the rain is over and gone;

paragraphs.content: The flowers appear on the earth; the time of the singing of birds is come, and the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;
paragraphs.contentHtml: The flowers appear on the earth; the time of the singing of birds is come, and the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;

paragraphs.content: The fig tree putteth forth her green figs, and the vines with the tender grape give a good smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The fig tree putteth forth her green figs, and the vines with the tender grape give a good smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.

paragraphs.content: ¶ O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock, in the secret places of the stairs, let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; for sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock, in the secret places of the stairs, let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; for sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely.

paragraphs.content: Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines have tender grapes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines have tender grapes.

paragraphs.content: ¶ My beloved is mine, and I am his: he feedeth among the lilies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ My beloved is mine, and I am his: he feedeth among the lilies.

paragraphs.content: Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be thou like a roe or a young hart upon the mountains of Bether.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be thou like a roe or a young hart upon the mountains of Bether.
